meanings.definition: A small particle or cell, especially a red or white blood cell.
meanings.sent1: Under the microscope, the corpuscle appeared as a tiny red dot.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the corpuscle under the microscope to understand its structure.
meanings.sent3: The corpuscle decided to join the red blood cell party because it felt left out.
meanings.sent4: Each corpuscle in the body worked together like a team of tiny superheroes.
meanings.sent5: The corpuscle danced through the bloodstream, carrying oxygen to every part of the body.

meanings.sent1: The corpuscle of dust floated in the sunbeam, barely visible to the naked eye.
meanings.sent2: The pond water was teeming with tiny corpuscles, each playing a vital role in the ecosystem.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous wind scattered every corpuscle of confetti across the party venue.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the sky was painted with a myriad of colorful corpuscles.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstroke captured every corpuscle of light in the stunning landscape painting.
